name: Hollywood Orchid Suites

reviews.text: It's next to the Kodak theatre. Excellent location, and the Metro station is right there. Lots to see, shop and eat. There are city tours available from different vendors along Hollywood Blvd. We took the Metro to Studio City (only one stop away).
reviews.title: 5 Star Location!

reviews.text: Due to a holiday weekend, the rate was higher. I picked this hotel due to it's location and free parking (in garage!). The room/unit is spacious and comes with a kitchen. The unit is a bit old, but it's clean. Breakfast was so..so.. the usual muffin, bagel, fruits, coffee. Wifi connection was excellent. There is also a computer/printer for guest use. Staff is helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: Great position

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice basic and clean hotel literally behind the Kodak theater. We stayed here for a week and had a very good time. Helpful receptionists, good breakfast, pool and laundry available and very reasonably priced, highly recommended.
reviews.title: Perfect for our needs.

reviews.text: I can't comment on anything other than our room and our stay, which for our needs, was perfect. All we wanted was reasonably priced accommodation with free parking in a good location in Hollywood, and doing my research it seemed that this place fit the bill. It did; in Spades. I was expecting basic, motel type accommodation like I get at home, and was pleasantly surprised at how spacious, homey, clean and comfortable our room was. We ended up mid-stretch on the second floor which turned out to be a good compromise. Some rooms have different setups so it pays to do a little research for what you want. I found them good to deal with via email before arriving. When booking, I missed out on the room type I liked, but when I got there, that room type was free so i got it anyway.
reviews.title: Brilliant

reviews.text: Some rooms had their own balcony and others were more private, but room 206 was still a winner. We had a good sized lounge and kitchen area, lots of storage, a bath/shower and separate vanity area. Floor 2 is the same floor as breakfast and the free internet pc (couldn't get the free wifi to work but that was due to user error), and 206 backed on to a side alley so I'm thinking had less noise than those that backed onto the street or were near the elevator. Even so, there was some truck noise early in the (weekday) morning, but this is pretty much unavoidable in such a central location. The front windows had thick glass which helped. We didn't mind as it meant we got a jump start on the day.
reviews.title: Yes! Yes! Yes!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent a week at this nice little hotel tucked away in Hollywood. Although the view from our room was not worth a dime, the proximity to all the places we wanted to see was the best!
reviews.title: Big rooms and Close to it all

reviews.text: Our room was huge, spacious with a mirrored double sliding closet and great kitchenette with all you need to make meals. It was like having an apartment instead of a room. In fact, this building was once an apartment complex, I was told by the locals.
reviews.title: Location, location, location

likes.disliked: — Its dated, but that's no biggie

reviews.text: Hollywood and Highland is literally just steps away from the very secure locking front door. This was very good for me since I was using a cane to get around at the time.
reviews.title: We like this hotel

likes.disliked: — Needed sprucing up. New carpet, paint, etc.

reviews.text: The shuttle bus to Griffith's Observatory is also at Hollywood and Highland, on the Orange Street side of the complex. VERY handy!
reviews.title: Very clean and convenient

likes.liked: — Air conditioner was a little noisy but not very bothersome

reviews.text: Parking for the Orchid Suites is underground and very tight. Take your time parking and exiting.
reviews.title: Best One Star Rated Hotel in My Book!

reviews.text: My daughter, grandson and I stayed 2 nights August 15-16,2007 at the Orchid Suites Hotel.The hotel is walking distance to Hollywood and Highland Mall and all the other Hollywood sites. Our room had 2 queen beds,full kitchen and a balcony. Our first night we went to the mall for the whole evening and returned to our room around 9:00PM. The next day we went to Universal Studios and it was late when we returned so parking was an issue in the uderground parking lot but someone was leaving as we came back so we were able to park. Some parking spaces are very tight. There is also parking on the street.Our last morning we went back to mall before check-out. We would recommend this hotel to everyone. We felt safe walking to the mall. There is a post office right before the entrance to the mall. There's a lot of restaurants in the mall. Fun,fun fun!!
reviews.title: GREAT LOCATION
Apartment accommodation at budget hotel prices
reviews.text: Being in LA for ten days I wanted more than just a hotel room and this was it! My deluxe room, at around $116/night, was a one bedroom apartment with plush sofa and armchairs, dining area, full kitchen and separate bedroom (with heaps of closet space) and well-appointed bathroom. And essential for the modern traveller - free high speed wi-fi. (there is also a fixed internet terminal avail free on the first floor). The spacious suite was well kept, clean and pleasant - I overlooked the pool and there is also a roof-top garden, as well as laundry facilities. Staff, from the management, to reception desk and cleaning staff, were lovely - helpful, and courteous. I was going to move to Venice Beach for my last four days - but I loved Orchid Suites so much I stayed on there! It really felt like a home away from home.
Location is fantastic and close to buses and trains to everywhere. Don;t believe the myth - you can get around L.A. easily and cheaply on public transport.
reviews.title: What's not to love?!?!

likes.disliked: — That we could only spend a week there!

reviews.text: The most amazing hotel! When we arrived we could BELIEVE the location it is LITERALLY next door to the Hollywood and Highland Centre, The Kodak Theatre (where they have the Oscars) Mann's Chinese Theatre, INCREDIBLE! You walk out the door of the hotel go through the passageway at the back of the centre and there you are right in the middle of the Centre, in the middle of Hollywood Blvd. You couldn't get a better location.
reviews.title: Great Location, Great Value, Great Everything

reviews.text: The staff were so friendly and helpful and the room was AMAZING. We had 4 girls staying in the room and we could have fit more. 2 giant beds and a couch with tonnes of room still to spare, a full kitchen with table and 4 chairs and a bathroom. There was a safe in the wardrobe with an electronic lock, a powerful ac in the room and a little balcony overlooking the pool (which was also lovely). There was a laundry room in the basement with vending machines (mainly drinks).
reviews.title: Excellent Location and Value

reviews.text: The best position you could ask for! 20 metres from the rear entrance to Hollywood and Highland. Suite 300 is a large, older style one bedroom apartment with full kitchen facilities. Breakfast is rudimentary but sufficient. Excellent value for the price. Alas the wifi only worked for a few hours of our five night stay.
reviews.title: Position position position

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first trip to LA and we really had no idea where to stay. This was ideal location because it was literally a minute to the walk of fame, Hollywood Blvd etc. It was tucked away so that it was in a quiet area but within a minute you were right in the middle of everything! Just what you want!
reviews.title: All about the location!

reviews.text: The hotel itself was nice enough, just your standard hotel. The lady who checked us in was so helpful, really lovely. I was really impressed by her and she really gave us lots of helpful information. The staff put up a poster in the lift with all the news so that you know if there is a film premiere in the area etc. They also include cinema times and what's on at the theatre. It's little touches like that that fill you with confidence. As I said standard hotel but staff really gave that bit extra.
reviews.title: Great location for Hollywood

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you do go to LA then consider hiring a car. Although my husband did most of the driving it was the easiest way to see Santa Monica - which is a gorgeous area! You can also drive to Beverley Hills, Venice Beach, Disney etc. It's really handy. If you don't drive then the hop on hop off bus is your best bet. It just takes a bit longer.
reviews.title: Great value and location but olde world

reviews.text: Our family of 3 stayed for 2 nights in early July. The room included a fully equipped kitchen with table and chairs, bathroom and 2 double beds. The pool was very inviting in the LA heat and the included breakfast (more unusual where you have a kitchen) was quite adequate including cereal, juice, bagels and croissants. There was limited seating but trays were provided to carry it back to your own unit. The location is superb-a short walk through the back entrance to the Hollywood and Highland Centre with its shops and restaurants and attractions, the red line metro and buses like the 217 that goes direct to The Grove shopping centre/Farmers Market and LACMA.
reviews.title: Great Bargain
good value
reviews.text: My 10 year old daughter and I had a 3 day stopover in Hollywood and stayed and the Orchid Suites. I found the staff excellent, very helpful, you cannot get a better location for this money, and for the price, very clean and large rooms, complete with kitchens, so you can save on meal expenses. The staff will book your tours, and Hollywood and Highland Shopping Complex is literally a stones through away. Very safe part of Hollywood, and highly recommended for families. The only downside is it is a bit noisey and not great views.

reviews.title: Above average stay
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights - fantastic location, right behind Chinese theatre - couldnt fault this - definitely made stay easy and convenient.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have just stayed here for two nights, it was excellent, it cost us about £45 a night and was well worth it, two mins walk from kodak theatre, walk of fame etc.
reviews.title: excellent location, great value, clean and confortable

reviews.text: Very Clean, comfortable suites with kitchen and massive bathroom etc.
reviews.title: Big rooms, great location

likes.disliked: — non existing parking location prior to check-in

reviews.text: Free internet access to catch up on your emails etc,
reviews.title: Great Location, Great Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Best location in town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Decor a bit dated but in terms of value for money and location i think you would struggle to do better than this in los angeles.
reviews.title: Great location and value for money

likes.liked: — The spacious room and excellent location
likes.disliked: — Was very dark in the living room - a few more lights would have been handy!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location. Very near Hollywood and Highland shopping centre and metro. Handy for visiting universal studios by metro. Can walk to Hollywood sights such as Graumans Chinese theatre.
reviews.title: great

likes.disliked: — Shortcut through access road of large neighbouring hotel needs care.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spacious suite with kitchenette.
reviews.title: Excellent!

reviews.text: No problems. Reasonable price.
reviews.title: Perfect- Could Not Rate More Highly
Great location!
reviews.text: We stayed at Hollywood Orchid Suites for 7 nights during the first week of December. We arrived at 8am after traveling from Australia for over 16 hours. Thankfully, the staff were great and very friendly and our room was ready for us to check into. Although the room wasn't the most beautiful place we've seen, it was clean and well presented.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a King Executive room, which was huge. There was a separate kitchen with full size fridge and microwave, as well as a good sized table which could seat four.
reviews.title: Excellent Find!

reviews.text: The location of this place is fantastic, only a few seconds' walk from the Hollywood Highland Center and Hollywood Blvd, with all of the touristy sights such as Graumann's Chinese Theater and the Walk of Fame. Another huge bonus of the Orchid Suites is the free internet access offered. Although there is only one computer, we never had a problem with waiting to use it.
reviews.title: New Year at the Orchid

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was a strange smell in the room when we arrived, but it turned out to be the cleaning products and didn't really bother us too long.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for, but great location!

reviews.text: The only criticism we have is that the room was a little old and worn out, but that seemed to be LA in general. For the light sleepers, remember to pack earplugs - we could hear the person in the room next door snoring every night, so loudly it was as though we were in the same room.
reviews.title: Wow! What a great find!!

reviews.text: Enjoy!
reviews.title: Excellent Location
Good Hotel - needs updating a bit.
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel 3 nights during a west coast trip that included LA and San Diego. The location was unbeatable, just behind the Kodak Theatre/Mall and walking minutes to Hollywood Blvd's main attractions! We also purchased discount tickets for Universal Studios from the hotel desk for $52 ea and rode the Metro one stop (a Metro stop is also minutes away) to Univeral's front gate.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel staff was friendly and accommodating. The room was huge, (more of a suite that included a bedroom, bath, kitchenette, and TV room), a bit dark and dated, but clean. A bonus was the free secure parking under the hotel, (yes the spots are tight but i was driving a compact!)
reviews.title: Recommended

likes.disliked: — Bit of noise in the mornings, but I think this was only from tempoary work on another hotel.

reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay, the hotel may be a little old but everything is there, Large comfortable bed comfortable couches and arm chairs, nicely decorated, a kitchen with the basics needed if you planned to cook. We asked for a quite room and had no complaints . The best thing about The Orchid is it's location, it's behind the Kodak Theatre, so away from the noise but so close to all the action. There is a walkway you can access which makes it very easy. The Metro is Hollywood/Highland and the buses will take you everywhere for just $5 for a day ticket. You could take a shuttle from the airport then a couple of trains all for the cost of $5. The staff are really nice and so helpful, it was an ideal location and most enjoyable stay.
reviews.title: Perfect for us.
Great location fantastic staff
reviews.text: Awesome staff here, everyone was so friendly and helpful, perfect location, was handy to have a kitchen and two king beds, decor is a bit outdated but the rooms were very clean and comfortable, it was nice to have a dining room table in room, breakfast is usual continental bagels, muffins, cereal, oatmeal, was stocked well everyday. We had a great time and also at the desk the tours and universal tickets are cheaper! Would come back here for sure!

This was one of the best hotels i stayed at during my trip to America (This was my second time in the US). The front desk (who was the owner at the time we checked in) was lovely, as a group of 12 people we needed to make changes of rooms last minute and she was so helpful and did everything we requested with no fuss. She was so polite and down to earth.
reviews.title: Fabulous Place To Stay!

reviews.text: The hotel is also less than 200m away from Hollywood Blvd. You exit the hotel turn right go down the shopping mall and you walk in to some shops and also places to eat (that was very convenient) and then BOOM there is Madame Tussauds Wax Museum, The Stars Walk, Manns Chinese Theater, EVERYTHING. But you hardly hear any of the noise from the hotel.
reviews.title: Perfect!
Dated yet great.......
reviews.text: The train is also just outside on the Blvd and that takes you right near Universal Studios!

I doubt there could be a lower priced hotel room located in as good a location in Los Angeles. Our room was spacious and was pretty much like a studio apartment. Washers and dryers are located in the basement next to the underground parking. Just across the road is the super luxurious Renaissance Hotel with room rates 3 times that of the Hollywood Orchid Suites. If money is not an issue, stay at the Renaissance. For those with a limited budget like us, the Hollywood Orchid Suites is a really good option. We did have problems with the noise though. We were woken up at 4am by loud laughter and excited girls' voices outside our room. The next night, we were woken up by heavy footsteps and other banging noises from the room above ours. The walls are so thin that we can hear the people staying in the room next to ours talking to each other. But, we were out most of the day. It's a short walk to the Metro from where it's one stop away from Universal Studios in one direction, and one stop away from the Pantages Theatre (where we watched an excellent performance of Wicked) in the other direction.
reviews.title: Thin walls

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had tickets to the Star Wars In Concert show at the Hollywood Bowl and decided to spend a little time in Hollywood at the same time, since we haven't been there in about 20 years. First, we couldn't have picked a better location for our trip. The shuttles to the Bowl were about a 2-3 minute walk from our hotel. The mall at Highland Ave is about 100 feet from the hotel. Hollywood Blvd is maybe another 100-150 feet or so, through the mall. Right next door to the mall, sort of part of it actually, is the Kodak and Chinese Theaters. Ripleys, Guinness Book and both wax museums are within one block. The El Capitan Theater is right across the street. Any little shop you might want to visit is pretty much right there, as are many night clubs (within a couple blocks) and places to eat. It seems all of the bus tours start from Highland as well. So location is just awesome. We parked our car on Saturday afternoon and didn't need it till we left the next afternoon. As for the hotel itself, it appears that it was possibly an apartment building way back in the day, probably the 60's? And at some point it was converted into a hotel. So the rooms are pretty old, sure. But everything we saw was very clean and well kept. We're fairly picky with that stuff (though willing to take chances) but we had no complaints at all. The rooms are very good size, including bathroom and kitchen. It's plain style but "cute". The hotel is the same, neat little layout and felt comfortable. It was interesting to walk up to the roof to see the patio area. The pool area is small but seems nice. The parking garage is underneath the building and there are plenty of easy-to-get-into parking spaces. The garage and the hotel itself are locked, you have to use your key to enter. The staff is very friendly and helpful. I stayed here just with my wife but we're planning on taking the kids with us to sight-see and we're definitely staying here again.
reviews.title: Awesome!

reviews.text: This was a great hotel for our family holiday. Easy walk to all Hollywood attractions and met station 5 mins away. Room was spacious and clean with microwave, stove and coffee maker. The continental breakfast had a selection of cereals and pastries with enough variety to satisfy all family members. Swimming pool was clean and warn and there is a nice area to sit. Most impressive thing about this hotel is the friendly staff who can't do enough for you. If you want great value on a budget then highly recommend.
reviews.title: lovely little hotel

reviews.text: Just like the old saying about real estate, the location is the big selling point for the Hollywood Orchid Suites. You're just steps away from an entrance to the Hollywood-Highland Mall that fronts Hollywood Boulevard, so all the great Hollywood attractions are within easy walking distance. The free underground garage is a convenient bonus in a city where "free parking" is largely unheard of.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location (is great!)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This establishment looks like it was once an apartment building. Imagine a one-bedroom apartment with a queen sofa bed (or a king-size bed) in the living room and you'll get the picture. With an apartment-sized full kitchen and dining area, you can make all of your own meals, although the complimentary breakfast is fine if you like cereal, muffins, bagels, donuts and fruit. If you're serious about cooking for yourself, stop by the Ralph's on N. LaBrea Ave. near Fountain for groceries. Or check out the 99-Cent Only Store at N. LaBrea and Willoughby that has a large Grocery Department including baked goods, frozen food and fresh produce.
reviews.title: Best bargain ever and will be back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The front desk staff was very friendly and the common areas are quite clean. There's an outdoor pool and a roof garden for relaxation after a long day of touring. Because the Kodak Theatre building is between you and Hollywood Boulevard, it's pretty quiet too.
reviews.title: Good Value would recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In the end I took a punt and booked at Orchid Suits and we were not disappointed. While the rooms are dated they are clean and comfortable and the location cannot be beat. We had a car so drove around the rest of LA but being so close to all the main parts of Hollywood was a bonus and there were heaps of shops and restaurants nearby plus all the Hollywood attractions.
reviews.title: Great location for budget travellers
What a Dump!
reviews.text: It was really easy to park in the undercover carpark and we had a 1bed king room with kitchen facilities that was all clean and tidy and everything worked well.
If it is 5 star luxury you are after then you will be dissappointed by this place but if it is a clean room with lots of space and good location for a good price then this place is excellent.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had stayed here before in Summer of '06, and returned in January for a second visit. The rooms are big, but have seen better days and a refurb is overdue. However, the location, staff and price more than make up for it! if you want to stay in Hollywood, you'd really struggle to get a better location. The hotel literally backs on to Manns Theatre on Hollywood Boulevard. We had 2 nights here, drove to Vegas, and then came back for 1 more night before flying home, so stayed in 2 different rooms. We had no problems with noise/neighbours etc. The kitchen is well equipped, and also had a dining area which was a bonus. Area feels safe; the first time we stayed we walked up to the Hollywood Bowl at night to see the LA Philharmonic Orchestra play Tchaikovsky with fireworks - amazing experience, and we don't even like classical music!!! Would recommned Mels Diner for dinner and/or breakfast - ask reception for directions!!
reviews.title: Unbeatable Location!

reviews.text: We booked this hotel for 4 people to spend a couple of nights in Hollywood. We picked it based on the reviews on this site and the cost. The location can not be beat if you want to experience Hollywood and still have a peaceful night's sleep. It is right behind the Hollywood and Highland Center, and you have your own walkway from the hotel into the shopping mall part of the center. You can walk to food, shopping, attractions, the Metro, and everything else imagineable. The hotel itself has secure parking and a front door that has to buzz you in, so you are certainly safe. The staff was friendly and accomodating. They gave us extra towels for the pool and for the room. The pool did not seem heated as advertised. There was no view to speak of as well. The rooms are average and the property could use some updating. Nevertheless, it was very clean and presentable.
reviews.title: Great location; average lodging

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 3 nights when in LA, great location as mentioned in previous reviews. After staying in a few motels on our journey, it was nice to have a couch and kitchen to make a home from home for a few days. Yes, the rooms are a bit dated but quite adequate and comfortable. Great free internet access and loads of secure parking underground, we enjoyed our stay here and got a good price for the location.
reviews.title: Good rooms, great location

likes.liked: — Great location, spacious with couch and armchairs, 2 tvs
likes.disliked: — slightly dated but fine for our needs.

reviews.text: Booked direct with the hotel. If we go back to hollywood I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Great motel

reviews.text: Hollywood was good but a little bit dirty compared to the rest of LA, and came away a little disappointed. Took a while to find nice places to eat, would recommend Mels Diner and also the posh burger place - 25 degrees in the Roosevelt hotel which are both nearby.
reviews.title: Location! Location!

likes.liked: — Clean, felt really comforable and close to everything!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is excellent accommodation at a reasonable price. The location is ideal (right behind Kodak Theatre in Hollywood). Great pool. The decor in the rooms is a little old, but its clean and the kitchen is well appointed. As a family of 5, I booked 2 adjoining rooms which opened up together, so we had 2 bathrooms. It was fantastic. I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Good Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed at this property and all I can say is WOW! It was a great experience. Yes the property was originally an apartment building that has been converted to a hotel but you would never really know. Our room had a massive bedroom, a bathroom, seperate kitchen and little table with four chairs. The price was reasonable, the room was clean, the parking and breakfast was included and the staff was extremely helpful! This really is one of the best kept secrets in Hollywood. If you are looking for a simple room with the basic things included this is the place for you.
reviews.title: A Must Stay!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you Orchid Suites..... our visit was great!
reviews.title: Amazing location! Better than expected!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: (We never used the pool but it looked very clean....and the location is fantastic for anyone with or without a car!)
reviews.title: Almost on the Walk of Fame

reviews.text: After reading several LA hotel reviews I was struggling where to stay because of all the negatives. In the end we opted for this one as it had the least bedbug reviews! The location to begin with was amazing for a hollywood visit! it was a literal 20 second walk from the main part of hollywood blvd and is situated directly behind the kodak theatre. Breakfast was substatial and our room was well located with more facilities you could imagine. We had a full on house kitchen! the one negative is the deliveries to kodak theatre from trucks start at 6am and im a light sleeper but you could avoid this by not having a ground floor or front facin room. Staff where helpful and excellent.
reviews.title: Good location, but rooms were old

reviews.text: We stayed here for three nights. This hotel has got quite big rooms! We got a room on the 2nd floor on the front (Orchid Street). We liked it immediately. The door is on the inside of the building, next to the breakfast area (noisy in the morning) and in the same space as the reception.
reviews.title: Fawlty Towers!

reviews.text: We are a family of four who stayed at this Hotel for 3 nights. The positives to this Hotel are :
reviews.title: Okay, but Noisy !

reviews.text: - Location (short walk to the Boulevard and right behind major shopping centre....this is also a weakness, refer below)
reviews.title: Great for the Price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Free Internet
reviews.title: Not an Orchild, but a daisy

reviews.text: - Large rooms
reviews.title: NEVER AGAIN!

reviews.text: - Good security (front door access via key or reception clearance)
reviews.title: Great Location!!!! at a reasonable price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights end of May. We got a very large suite, with a full kitchen, outdoor patio, closet, and a safe. Location was very close to a lot of the action, but the hotel didn't get any street noise which was nice. The free breakfast was good. They have a computer and printer that the guests can use. Free underground parking. My only negative comment would be the room wasn't as clean as it could be, I saw some dust in a few corners. But overall I think this hotel is very good value.
reviews.title: Very Good
Good choice
reviews.text: Perfect location, close to all main attractions! Not luxery but clean and big rooms, bed a bit soft. The staff that we met was all very sweet and helpfull. Remember to book your tours and Universial tickets at the front desk, you will then get a discount.

reviews.title: Excellent value for such a central location
reviews.text: We stayed for 2 nights at the Orchard Suites and were very pleased with our stay - the room was large, clean and comfortable and the staff was friendly. The heated pool was an added bonus, nice to use after a hot day. The best thing about this place is its location and price - it is literally 2 minutes walk from the Chinese Theatre and Walk of Fame (and quite noisy as a result but that's the only major downside).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location for everything. Tea & Coffee available during the day was great. Breakfast basic, but adequate; cereals, toast, muffins, fresh fruit. Smallish area but can take tray back to Room. Staff could not do enough for you. Genuine friendliness was fantastic. Nice swimming pool & laundry. We had a King Suite with Lounge area and kitchen, nice bathroom en-suite. Small in room safe. Great value for money! Have to climb stairs up to Reception area from street level or enter through Car Park and take lift. Good free Wi-Fi . Everything at your doorstep!
reviews.title: Fantastic Hospitality & Service

reviews.text: Stayed with my friends for two nights in June 2012.I'm very pleased with the service and the room.My friends and I stayed at the Executive Suite.The room with two double beds is spacious
reviews.title: A reasonably-priced hotel in the heart of Hollywood

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We decided to stay at the Hollywood Orchid Suites, due to the wonderful reviews we read here on Trip Advisor. It was as the reviewer below me explained, a converted apartment building. The beds, as stated were awful, one of them even had ripped up sheets on the bed! The tubs...same as the other person said...dirty and the skid strips looked nasty..I am wondering if we had the same room, or if they are all like this! There is a kitchen, dont look around too much..you might see the roach motel that is in the bottom cupboard! I hated it here, I hated Hollywood period, but this hotel sure didnt help!
reviews.title: cheap...you get what you pay for

reviews.text: They said that there is a roof top garden..there is...but nothing to write home about. I think the cleanest thing here was all the clothes in my bags, that never went into any of those drawers!
reviews.title: What a dump!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place, is convenient, cheap and very accesible to all the Hollywood things, but if you can pick somewhere clean, and with more comfortable beds and sans the roach motel...I would do that instead.
reviews.title: a superb value in Hollywood!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes it is cheap. Yes it is in a good location.
reviews.title: The Orchid can't be beat

reviews.text: But I wish I had paid more at a clean hotel and not felt like I had to wear shoes in the room because I did not want to step on the carpet with my bare feet.
reviews.title: Location and value, plus spacious!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we werent planning on staying in los angeles on this trip and it was a last minute decision to visit LA (literally 10.30pm at night) i rang the hotel, they said they had a room available - and when we arrived after midnight the check in staff member was really helpful and welcoming.
reviews.title: just as good the 2nd time

reviews.text: Huge room with everything we needed. Breakfast is minimal but more than sufficient. Will stay here again if we visit hollywood again in the future
reviews.title: Hollywood Orchid Suites: Location, good price
Great hotel, fantastic location
reviews.text: We were a mother-young daughter pair staying at Orchid. Overall the location is better than Magic Castle, but the facilities, service and breakfast were not nearly as good. Orchid is a decent and cheaper alternate to Magic Castle, especially if you want to be closer to the action and don't need or want to pay for a separate bedroom.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: PROS: Location -- It's located directly behind the Kodak Theatre and you can walk through a small passageway to get to the shops at Hollywood & Highland. Since we were two females, it was nice to be so close to everything in Hollywood. At first I was concerned, because being next to the backside of the theatre means you are near the loading dock and it can be quiet during the night, but it was fine. Kitchen -- This is always a plus if you're traveling with kids. There wasn't a grocery store nearby, but we could bring back leftovers or snacks and reheat them or keep things cool in the fridge. Free computer and printer in breakfast room -- This was useful for looking up directions, printing out boarding passes.
reviews.title: Very convenient and friendly hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: CONS: Although clean, the facilities need an upgrade. Some of the rooms look like they were renovated, so inquire about that. The pool was just "meh" and was pretty cold when we were there, because the expansive wall of the Kodak Theatre blocks direct sun for half the day.
reviews.title: First time in Hollywood
Great location, great hotel
reviews.text: This might be the place to be when staying in Los Angeles. Located right behind the Kodak Theatre and Hollywood Boulevard, this is the best hotel I've stayed in Los Angeles. At $109/night for two person, we got a wonderful executive suite with a kitchen, which was enough for two people to cook in, and four people to eat in. The room had sliding door so you could easily walk onto the balcony. We had a wonderful view of the Hollywood Hills. Bed is comfortable and a huge King size, bathroom is excellent, and there's a big closet. Hotel has a pool, but we didn't use it, since there's so much to do.

reviews.title: Great location
reviews.text: Staff: Very friendly and efficient. But my favorites were the cleaning staff. All of them were totally sweet and friendly and very helpful. And they seemed to appreciate to be able to talk to some of the guests. Our room was cleaned and left spotless each day.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location: Excellent, since you can do some shopping very close by and the area is very safe. You can easily walke around at night in the area, but don't wander to far up Hollywood Boulevard. The block aroud the hotel is very safe, up until the Gap there's no worries. And if you plan a trip to Universal Studios, don't take your car, but take the metro, since it's close to the hotel and the Studios are only one stop away.
reviews.title: Great location for Hollywood
Orchid a fine base for seeing LA by transit
reviews.text: Traffic: This is LA and Highways are terrible. We went to Santa Monica from the Hotel and took Road 66. Major road works, so we got stuck for quite some time. Same thing with the Highways. And if you wanna go to orchid suites coming from Hollywood Boulevard, beware that you are not allowed to make a left turn onto Franklin Avenue at rush hour. I would advice you to turn left onto LaBrea Avenue from Sunset or Hollywood Boulevard and then a right onto Franklin Ave. It's gonna save you a lot of time and trouble. And if you get stuck in traffic. Keep calm and turn up the music!

reviews.title: Orchid suites a good choice when staying in Hollywood
reviews.text: Parking: The hotel has a closed garage only guests can use, so no worries there.

This hotel was in the best location with only a short walk to Hollywood Boulevard where the stars are on the footpath. The hotel is not 5 star but it is very close to it with LCD TV screens, free parking, a full kitchen with full sized fridge and oven. Even though the hotel is a little older than others, our room was very clean and would rate the cleanliness 5 star! There is a heated outdoor pool and apparently a great view from the very top level where there is a garden - I didn't get a chance to see it but hopefully next time! They also have a computer to access the internet for free and there is free wi-fi in the hotel. The continental breakfast had a fair bit of variety (no hot food because it is 'continental') which included pastries, bagels, cream cheese, cereals and fruit (no sliced bread though). We loved our stay and would definately go back!
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location, friendly staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you're spending a few days in LA, that's a good hotel stay in. Walking distance to Hollywood's main restaurants, bars and clubs so that you dont need to worry about drinking&driving or else parking, but still in a quiet little street behind the Kodak Theater.
reviews.title: Huge rooms, great spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are pretty big, so you'll have space for the shopping bags and clothes, they have free parking, vending machines, laundry room and a very nice staff 24/7. And it has a good price too!
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: Just a little headsup though: the wifi wont work in macs or iPads! Maybe they'll fix it, but we had that inconvinience.
reviews.title: Few problems but I liked the place

reviews.text: Great tip we got from TripAdvisor, I'd be back.
reviews.title: Location location

description: The Hollywood Orchid Suites owes its success to a superior location and a commitment to security, friendly service and value. We are next door to the Hollywood & Highland Center which includes TCL Chinese Theatre (formerly Grauman's Chinese Theatre), the Dolby Theatre(formerly known as Kodak Theatre) (home of the Academy Awards), the Loew's Hotel Hollywood, the METRO station, Madame Tussauds Wax Museum, Walk of Fame, movie theaters, restaurants, clubs, bowling lanes and shopping. We are within close walking distance to the Hollywood Bowl, the Roosevelt Hotel, The Magic Castle and Yamashiro. Universal Studios and Pantages Theatre at Hollywood & Vine is just one subway stop away. Most of our rooms have fully equipped kitchens and a dining area. We offer a complimentary, light continental breakfast, free WIFI and free local calls.
